intro: Euphrasia tholeyroniana, commonly known as the Tholey's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous tiny, tubular flowers arranged in clusters. Euphrasia tholeyroniana is valued in traditional medicine for its potential healing properties.
